column7: Course is designed to familiarize students with theory and research at the intersection of advertising and psychology. Explores issues pertaining to advertising psychology, including: basic research methodology, the emergence of trends, attitudes and persuasion, human and brand personality, cross-cultural advertising, implicit consumer cognition, judgment and decision making, and others. 3 undergraduate hours. No graduate credit. Credit is not given for ADV 478 if credit for the Psychology of Advertising section of ADV 490 has been earned. Prerequisite: ADV 281 or equivalent.
